text: Excellent restaurant! Very good breakfast... the view can't be beat. The service was friendly and attentive to our needs..

Really cool place by the water in Verdun. They are right across a Marina and have a huge parking available. It really is a prime location for a sunny, family Sunday stroll since the restaurant is right next to plenty of kids playground (to evacuate the energy they accumulate after eating) and right next to cycling path. 

As an eggs Benedict aficionado, I was not disappointed by the variety. I mean this place has so much dishes you have no choice but to come back. Really happy with the discovery, will definitely return.

First of all i was hoping for a romantiky evening with my wife before i left for Toronto for two weeks... The waiter was very nice but a wee bit clumsy...the view was spectacular.  The food was tasteless we got there at 730 and they had already already.run out of mussels and the place was empty.  Calamari was slightly greasy and over cooked.  Who the hell gives pasta sauce with bread.  My wife's pasta was bland and tasteless even tough it supposedly had anchovies  and according to the chef was supposed to be drowned in oil.   My seafood pasta had yesterdays over cooked squid bits and cut up shrimp that was equally over cooked and i am pretty sure made to look like mussels.  Of the four types i was supposed to get i got two.  Suffice to say even the view is not worth it cuz i could get the same one for free just by walking in front of it like i do everyday....Run from this place.  At the price they ask for you are better off going to any Giorgios or Pacini or any other italian restaurant run by people who are not italian.

Great breakfast place. Staff is very attentive and courteous, and the service itself is very quick to come take your order and bring your food.
Le Geant is a delicious dish if you're very hungry, comes with really good potatoes and the bacon is perfectly cooked. Not 5 stars because the some of the green onions in the potatoes were old and tasted bad.

Would give it a 5 stars but I am a regular for weekend breakfast only so I don't think it would be fair.

The view is great, parking ample, the restaurant is nice, service is great and food is good (potatos are amazing!). 

The restaurant's acoustics are kind of bad which is my only bad thing to say. The noise seems to be reflected all over the place so it gets noisy.

Not a big deal really.

Great service with typical standard breakfast affair, large menu of options for crepes, french toasts and all sorts of eggs. 'By the water' location would be the only reason to come to this joint, if looking for a bit more interesting stuff, stick to plateau for best breakfasts Montreal has to offer.

Mis à part la gentillesse de la serveuse. Je ne recommande pas cette place. Le plat n'est pas à la hauteur. Pour couronner le tout, coquille d'oeuf dans mon oeuf poché et cheveux dans le brunch de ma copine. Ça ne devrait malheureusement pas arriver ce genre de choses

Mediocre food at relatively high prices for breakfast. This place is coasting on their waterfront view to cover inadequate meals.

Truly bizzare amounts of onion powder on the fried potatoes and cafeteria grade sausages for breakfast.
Beautiful waterside setting contrasted by tasteless eggs, greasy hash browns and weak coffee
We are regulars here now :)!! Great food, nice view and good service!

Service médiocre en cette fin de semaine! Primo, on nous a fait attendre +++ à la porte et fait passer plusieurs groupes qui sont arrivés après nous (sans réservation) et s'excusent à peine quand ils réalisent qu'ils nous avaient juste sauté sur la liste par oubli! Deuxièmement, plus d'une heure d'attente pour le service à la table avec 2 très jeunes enfants sans jamais proposer de servir les enfants d'abord ... le repas était de moindre qualité et les choix limités (pas de salade en fin de semaine avant 14:00hr). Même si le bord de l'eau est agréable, nous ne retournerons pas à ce resto!

Oh, I just LOVE this place.

Situated by the water in Verdun, Crescendo is a great little gem. Clean and always well organized in terms of service, we've never had a bad experience here in the last couple months (been back 5 times already!). The food is yummy, the portions are massive, presentation is great, and the prices are awesome. You really can't go wrong.

They have great soups and salads (you have to try their arugula salad..and their salmon salad..mmmm) as well as good meaty platters as well.

Always served with a free appetizer of bruschetta, followed by lots of bread and in house marinara sauce..

I want to go back just thinking about it. 

A great place for a quick and chill bite to eat.

Dress code is casual! 

Try it out and let me know if you like it!

ps. did you notice my distracted mind in the last few sentences? Haha..I just want to go have some yummy food there now...too bad it's almost midnight.....

The food is very ordinary. Nothing special so don't expect too much from it. 

The staff were friendly and our waiter was very nice. 

The best thing about this restaurant is the location and the view, as it is right next to the river. There is also free parking so if you come by car you can be sure to find a place.

Les Crescendo est un joli restaurant offrant une superbe vue sur l'eau, à Verdun. Sa salle à manger hyper lumineuse rend les brunchs du dimanche vraiment agréables et énergisants! Le restaurant ne sert pas que des brunchs, mais je n'y suis jamais allée pour le souper. Lorsque je suis déménagée à Verdun, j'allais assez souvent bruncher au Crescendo et j'aimais bien l'endroit. Cependant, plus j'y allais, moins j'appréciais. Le service est toujours assez bon, malgré quelques petites lacunes... surtout si on est un gros groupe! Lorsque j'y vais seule avec mon copain, tout va bien! Le service est rapide, courtois et la serveuse ou le serveur ne fait " jamais " d'erreurs. C'est une autre histoire lorsque nous y allons en famille, par exemple...c'est si long! Nos assiettes n'arrivent jamais à la table en même temps, ce qui est assez désagréable. Des ufs, ça refroidit vite! 

Côté nourriture, c'est assez irrégulier. Parfois les plats sont délicieux et bien chauds, mais à d'autres occasions ils sont moins bons, beaucoup trop salés et froids. J'aime aller bruncher à un endroit où je SAIS que la nourriture sera excellente à tout coup. Ce n'est malheureusement pas le cas du Crescendo. Maintenant que j'ai découvert d'autres restaurants 100 fois meilleurs pour le brunch, je n'y vais plus...
L'année dernière, le restaurant offrait les mimosas à 3,50 le dimanche, wow! Depuis un moment déjà, cette promotion plus qu'appréciée n'est plus en vigueur... Un peu dommage! Surtout qu'ils sont faits avec du jus d'orange bon marché et du mousseux pas très bon. Si quelqu'un insistait pour m'y emmener, j'irais sans doute en espérant m'y sentir comme au tout début... Après tout, leurs pommes de terre déjeuner sont si bonnes!
Great Italians food and recipes; amazing place (indoor and outdoor); unic place in Montreal,  enjoying the nature and the landscaper

Hands down best breakfast in the area. Always a pleasant experience to have an early breakfast on their terrasse. Service has always been good; coffee and water is refilled often and food comes quickly enough. I have tried most of the stuff on their breakfast menu (omelettes, crepes, french toast, eggs Benedict, traditional bacon-and-eggs) and have not yet been disappointed! I would definitely recommend this place.

Terrasse fantastique sur le bord du St-Laurent. Les spéciaux du dimanche au jeudi en font une très belle destination en semaine.  Mais le spécial St-Valentin n'est pas à la hauteur du menus en général. Et en passant rater la mousse d'un cappuccino avec Nespresso... c'est ordinaire.

First resto experience in Verdun, this is beyond my expectations ;) nice view and friendly waiters. 
Love the mussels. Large portion for a fair price.
Calamaris are also good.

Très bon petit resto du bord du fleuve
Leurs brunchs sont très bons et copieux
L'idéal est d'y aller l'été, on y respire la fraîcheur et on peut contempler le fleuve du resto
Il y a un peu de monde mais pas trop, pas de quoi faire un line up
Le service était très bon, les prix raisonnables
L'été, vous pouvez même y aller en Bixi, laisser le Bixi à une borne de Verdun et marcher 10mn pour y aller, ça vaut la peine :)
Nice place especially during the summer with a patio deck overlooking the river.

This is a great little restaurant located just a few minutes from my house, so I will likely be eating here a lot. 

I love sitting outside to eat in the summertime, and this place offers a great view to do just that. I went for brunch and was not disappointed with my French toast with fresh fruit and English cream which I ate while overlooking the St.Lawrence River. 

It looks like they have heaters on the terrace for cooler days/nights, which is great. It is also located by a bike path and park, where you can walk off your meal when you're done ;)

Te service was pretty good. The initial girl to bring us to our table didn't really say anything, so I was happy when I realized she would not be the waitress taking our order. A young waiter served us and was quite friendly. 

This place would get 5 stars if the portion sizes were a little bit bigger. The prices seem to be the same as any other restaurant, but I was able to eat my whole meal without feeling stuffed (which might be a good thing haha) and I felt I could have eaten a little more.
Ce resto vaut le détour, du moins pour sa superbe vue sur l'eau. Les déjeuners sont très similaires au resto du genre, bref, je n'ai pas été impressionnée.

I went for brunch with a group of 12. During our service, we ordered 5 fruit cocktails and all 5 were salty. After sending them back, they came back salty *again*! Aside from that flop, I'll admit that we were all quite satisfied wit our meals. The brunch menu was quite typical and they didn't go out of their way to make it particularly special. Bat that's ok, cause sometimes, all you want is an american-style breakfast. No frills. And, well, that's what you'll get at Crescendo. 

The one thing the place really has going: the view! It's a great spot to just sit and eat on the terrace while enjoying a nice view of the marina.

Très belle terrasse.  Restaurant en retrait de la rue. 
Très agreable d'être au soleil tôt le dimanche matin pour le petit déjeuner. 
ufs benedtines trop cuits, et portion de fruits dans l'assiette insuffisant mais en gros c'est bien. Manque un peu plus de raffinement dans l'assiette pour que j'y retourne à ce prix. Le service était très bien. Amical et efficace. Stationnement facile.

Le printemps est arrivé  Les gens se réveillent. Quel beau temps aujourd'hui. C'est sûr qu'on dois sortir de chez nous pour faire quelques choses, manger, boire, jouer, profitons-en... merci à printemps. J'espère que tout le monde va bien

La place côté fenêtre nous fait attendant pendant un certain temps, mais cela en veut la peine

Le restaurant Crescendo juste en face de ma maison, c'est seulement deuxième fois qu'on est y allé, mais je veux dire que c'est magnifique ce restaurant, j'aime j'aime j'aime j'aime, c'est tout
Very good breakfasts and not expensive at all... I came here last week after a long, intense and sweaty night and it did not disappoint...good food and friendly staff

On a nice sunny afternoon, I dropped in for a coffee and dessert to enjoy out on the terrace. I chose the creme caramel and an allongé.

My first impression was that my waiter found my arrival inconvenient (yeah, that kind of waiter).

Second impression: he brought my dessert to me in a chipped bowl. A big chip missing from the top rim. There were not many people there (2 couples), so he wasn't rushed off his feet and should have noticed. He didn't seem to care.

The creme caramel itself was just so-so. Nothing to write home about. Slightly overcooked and rubbery around the edges, more burnt flavor that the classic, nutty toasted flavor to the "caramel". 

The allongé was meh.

If you go, do it for the view. But don't expect stellar service and superior quality food.

Le Crescendo reste le restaurant où il me fait le plus plaisir de me lever de bonne heure pour passer mon déjeuner.

Tout juste à côté de chez moi, le crescendo offre une superbe vue sur la marina. Son menu et son service sont toujours excellent. 

Laissez vous tenter par le cocktail de fruits frais pour ensuite y aller avec un de leur déjeuner un peu plus santé. Terminer avec un grand bol de café au lait.

L'été, l'endroit possède une terrasse, idéal pour profiter du beau temps !

Imagine a sweet spot on the river, overlooking the marina,  shaded under trees, a hot, humid summer's day, you're famished and need some much-needed victuals to get started.

Well, if you're lucky enough to find yourself in Verdun, the ugly-duckling neighborhood in Montreal, which is very close to becoming a full-on swan, and is starting to give the much ballyhoo-ed Plateau and Mile-End a run for it's money, you can always stroll over to the riverside and have breakfast or brunch here.

This place has it all.
Bagels done up French-toast style, Eggs Benedict with goat cheese and smoked salmon, all the usual egg, meat and toast combos, dozens of versions of Eggs Benedict, omelets, waffles, French toast, pancakes, $3 mimosas, buckwheat pancakes and crepes, yoghurt and fruit served up in parfait glasses. Come here alone or with a friend and enjoy the start to a brand new day while tucking into great eats and taking in a great view. 
I'll be returning.

What happened? This was our fourth visit because we liked it so much. Not this time. We went on Sunday for brunch and surprisingly, it was very noisy and the service was left to be desired even though the restaurant was not packed full like it usually is. We both ordered omelettes, one veggie and one Western. Did you ever hear of overcooked eggs? That's what it was. When you try to cut into the omelette and it falls apart in small pieces, there's something VERY wrong. Mine had ham in it and the omelette was so overcooked that the pieces of ham were too hard to chew. Unfortunately for them, this is our last time. Dommage.

Très beau restaurant avec un bel emplacement proche du fleuve. La vue est agréable qu'on soit en extérieur ou en intérieur. Les assiettes de brunch sont très similaires au restaurant du genre. Le rapport qualité/prix est bien présent. Cependant, le service n'était pas à la hauteur. Serveuse peu souriante. Par une belle journée d'été, nous avons dû demandé à plusieurs reprises pour obtenir de l'eau.

La première fois que j'ai passé devant Crescendo je prennais une marche le long de la rivière en soirée en plein hiver. Si ça n'avait pas été du fait que ça m'a permis de voir des gens à l'intérieur en train de souper, je n'aurais jamais pensé que ce bâtiment est un restaurant car il donne plutôt l'impression d'un centre communautaire. En plus, pendant l'hiver, il y avait le foyer en marche qui m'a donné l'impression d'être un resto dispendieux.

Quelques mois plus tard, une fois que les tulipes ont fait leur apparition, j'y suis allée pour déjeuner après avoir fait quelques recherches et je n'ai pas été déçue. Les choix de déjeuners sont très nombreux ce qui a garanti un soupir exaspéré de la part de mon australien qui murmure "How long will it take you to decide today?"

Les assiettes sont très généreuses, les fruits sont frais et juteux et la patates sont un peu épicées pour leur donner un bon goût.Le prix sont corrects mais côté un peu plus dispendieux que la moyenne pour un déjeuner à Montéral. L'été, la terrasse est jolie avec une vue sur la rivière.

J'ai encore à y aller pour essayer le lunch ou le souper. À suivre...

Discover this restaurant for the first time. It's just right by the river in Verdun. Totally hidden from the up and coming restaurants in Wellington st. The inside is very nice and pleasant. I.e. not out dated. Recommended to make a reservation if you want to eat by the terrace. The table d'hote from Sunday to Thursday is what I go for. Great price and good portions.
